column1: Gānnán Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture (Chinese: 甘南藏族自治州; pinyin: Gānnán Zàngzú Zìzhìzhōu; Tibetan: ཀན་ལྷོ་བོད་རིགས་རང་སྐྱོང་ཁུལ་
column3: ZYPY: Gainlho Poirig Ranggyong Kü) is an autonomous prefecture in Southern Gansu Province
column4: China. It includes Xiahe and the Labrang Monastery
column6: Maqu and other mostly Tibetan towns and villages. Gannan has an area of 40
column8: 791 sq mi) and its capital is Hezuo (Zoi). In the first year of the proclamation of Gannan Autonomous District
column9: the district-seat was at the Labrang Town of Sangqu.

column1: In the prefecture is high-way G213. In 2013
column2: the Gannan Xiahe Airport was opened.

column1: A. Gruschke: The Cultural Monuments of Tibet’s Outer Provinces: Amdo - Volume 2. The Gansu and Sichuan Parts of Amdo
